sen.e: Ojoyoshu is a Buddhism book in one part and three volumes compiled in 985 by Genshin (monk), a Sozu (the Prelate) in Eshin-in Temple at Yokawa of Hiei-san Mountain, in which he collected important passages relating to "gokuraku ojo (the Pure Land of Amitabha where the dead are allowed to live peacefully)", extracting from many sources such as Buddhist scriptures and Abhidhamma-piTaka in terms of the Jodo sect.
